intro: Fernandezia parvifolia var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved fernandezia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped leaves that are typically less than 5 centimeters in length. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. It is native to parts of South America, particularly in Brazil and Argentina, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Fernandezia parvifolia var. parvifolia is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in forest understories or along stream banks.
